intro: Seseli setiferum, commonly known as the woolly seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant produces fluffy, feathery seeds that are dispersed by the wind, aiding in its spread. Native to regions of Europe and western Asia, it often grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its distinctive appearance and ecological role make it a notable species within its native range.
